Literature Review: The past two decades have witnessed a significant expansion in the availability, size, and precision of time-domain data sets in astronomy. This surge in data has been driven by advancements in observational technologies and the deployment of large-scale surveys, such as the Sloan Digital Sky Survey (SDSS) and the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS). The increasing volume and complexity of these data sets have necessitated the development of sophisticated statistical methods to extract meaningful information. Among these methods, Gaussian Process (GP) regression has emerged as a powerful and flexible tool for modeling stochastic signals in astronomical time series.
